title: Derbyâ€™s Take: Two Fed Indexes Show Underlying Inflation Picking Up
sub_head: Cleveland and Dallas Fed indexes show higher May inflation
body:
Two Federal Reserve indexes that aim to track underlying rates of inflation show that pressure continues to mount on that front, which will likely help keep the U.S. central bank on the path to raise rates.
On Thursday, the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas said that compared to a year ago, the Trimmed Mean PCE index rose to 4.0% for May from 3.8% in April and 3.7% in March.
